pullRequest.body:
This is the initial framework code for `lake exe refactor`. To use it, you add your refactoring to `Refactor/Main.lean` (note, you have to actually write some metaprogramming code here for the refactoring itself), and the harness will run it on specified files and apply the generated edits.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [bceba05eb1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13973/commits/bceba05eb1c1bd0837c86790104b921206d1f35d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Edit`
`+ help`
`+ instance : FromJson String.Pos := ⟨fun p => String.Pos.mk <$> fromJson? p⟩`
`+ instance : ToJson String.Pos := ⟨fun p => toJson p.1⟩`
`+ runRefactoring`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
@adomani can you say more about what you used this for/other branches with this?

I just linked one of the tests that I did with refactor.  The extra metacode that I wrote for that test is [this declaration](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13979/files#diff-4150dc665b50603f984572b346cbd6a8ff03660d6a2685bb37f388a3f0d1d03bR40).
I don't understand every detail, but it looks good on the nose.
I don't understand every detail, but it looks good on the nose.
What motivates the subprocess call here?
Lean elaborator processes compete for global variables, so it's not very reliable to run the elaborator on multiple different files without starting up a dedicated process for each one.

Something I think would be quite useful: a combinator for `Term` and `Tactic` refactorings.

Is the infotree from elaborating the command accessible in this handler? Should it be passed in explicitly?

```suggestion
/-- `lake exe refactor` performs refactors. -/
```
or something along these lines!
Is there a reason for not using `Cli`?

```suggestion
    let opts := {}
    -- allow `env` to be leaked, which would live until the end of the process anyway
```

Could you add an explanation to the module docstring how to exactly use this tool? The comments basically demonstrate it, but I think it would be useful for less experienced users to have these instructions in text form, too.

pullRequest.title: feat: lake exe refactor, initial framework
